results.title: The Effect of Metformin on Ethanol- and Indomethacin-Induced Gastric Ulcers in Rats
results.text_hl: A similar result was observed in @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-treated indo @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcer@@@ group.

citations.NLM: İpek BE, Yüksel M, Cumbul A, Ercan F, Cabadak H, Aydın B, Alican İ. The Effect of Metformin on Ethanol- and Indomethacin-Induced Gastric Ulcers in Rats Turk J Gastroenterol. 2022 Sep;33(9):767-776. PMID: 35946894
citations.BibTeX: @article{35946894, title={The Effect of Metformin on Ethanol- and Indomethacin-Induced Gastric Ulcers in Rats}, author={İpek BE and Yüksel M and Cumbul A and Ercan F and Cabadak H and Aydın B and Alican İ}, journal={Turk J Gastroenterol}, volume={33}, number={9}, pages={767-776}}

results.title: The effect of metformin on indomethacin-induced gastric ulcer: Involvement of nitric oxide/Rho kinase pathway.
results.text_hl: After the induction of @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcer@@@, @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were treated by @CHEMICAL_Omeprazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009853 @@@omeprazole@@@ (30 mg/kg) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (50, 100 or 200 mg/kg).

citations.NLM: AbdelAziz EY, Tadros MG, Menze ET. The effect of metformin on indomethacin-induced gastric ulcer: Involvement of nitric oxide/Rho kinase pathway. Eur J Pharmacol. 2021 Feb 5;892():173812. PMID: 33345855
citations.BibTeX: @article{33345855, title={The effect of metformin on indomethacin-induced gastric ulcer: Involvement of nitric oxide/Rho kinase pathway.}, author={AbdelAziz EY and Tadros MG and Menze ET}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={892}, pages={173812}}

results.title: The intervention of tert-butylhydroquinone protects ethanol-induced gastric ulcer in type II diabetic rats: the role of Nrf2 pathway.
results.text_hl: In @CHEMICAL_Ethanol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000431 @@@ethanol@@@-exposed @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, pretreatment with @CHEMICAL_2_tert_butylhydroquinone @CHEMICAL_MESH:C018855 @@@tBHQ@@@, @CHEMICAL_Omeprazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009853 @@@omeprazole@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduced @DISEASE_Stomach_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D013272 @@@gastric mucosal lesion@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcer@@@ index, histological alterations, @CHEMICAL_Malondialdehyde @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008315 @@@malondialdehyde@@@ level, and apoptosis.

citations.NLM: Rahman Z, Dwivedi DK, Jena GB. The intervention of tert-butylhydroquinone protects ethanol-induced gastric ulcer in type II diabetic rats: the role of Nrf2 pathway. Can J Physiol Pharmacol. 2021 May;99(5):522-535. PMID: 33095998
citations.BibTeX: @article{33095998, title={The intervention of tert-butylhydroquinone protects ethanol-induced gastric ulcer in type II diabetic rats: the role of Nrf2 pathway.}, author={Rahman Z and Dwivedi DK and Jena GB}, journal={Can J Physiol Pharmacol}, volume={99}, number={5}, pages={522-535}}

results.title: Fixed Drug Eruption Secondary to Four Anti-diabetic Medications: An Unusual Case of Polysensitivity
results.text_hl: Skin manifestations, including @DISEASE_Erythema @DISEASE_MESH:D004890 @@@erythema@@@, @DISEASE_Blister @DISEASE_MESH:D001768 @@@blisters@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcers@@@, developed over the right leg each time after the initiation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Gliclazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005907 @@@gliclazide@@@, @CHEMICAL_Vildagliptin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077597 @@@vildagliptin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_empagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C570240 @@@empagliflozin@@@; and disappeared following the discontinuation of the drugs.

citations.NLM: Al Masri D, Fleifel M, Hirbli K. Fixed Drug Eruption Secondary to Four Anti-diabetic Medications: An Unusual Case of Polysensitivity Cureus. 2021 Oct;13(10):e18599. PMID: 34786218
citations.BibTeX: @article{34786218, title={Fixed Drug Eruption Secondary to Four Anti-diabetic Medications: An Unusual Case of Polysensitivity}, author={Al Masri D and Fleifel M and Hirbli K}, journal={Cureus}, volume={13}, number={10}, pages={e18599}}

results.title: Risk factors for diabetic foot ulcers: an Albanian retrospective study of inpatients with type 2 diabetes.
results.text_hl: Correlation analysis (performed through the nonparametric Spearman's rank correlation test or through the parametric Pearson test, as appropriate) revealed a significant positive relationship between HbA1c and FPG (r=0.58; p<0.0001), @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcer@@@ surface area (r=0.50; p<0.0001), @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcer@@@ grade (r=0.23; p=0.02), minor LEAs (r=0.20; p=0.04), DPN (r=0.41; p<0.0001), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy alone (r=0.72; p<0.0001).

citations.NLM: Pastore D, Deja-Simoni A, De Stefano A, Pacifici F, Cela E, Infante M, Coppola A, Di Daniele N, Lauro D, Della-Morte D, Donadel G. Risk factors for diabetic foot ulcers: an Albanian retrospective study of inpatients with type 2 diabetes. Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci. 2022 Jan;26(2):558-572. PMID: 35113432
citations.BibTeX: @article{35113432, title={Risk factors for diabetic foot ulcers: an Albanian retrospective study of inpatients with type 2 diabetes.}, author={Pastore D and Deja-Simoni A and De Stefano A and Pacifici F and Cela E and Infante M and Coppola A and Di Daniele N and Lauro D and Della-Morte D and Donadel G}, journal={Eur Rev Med Pharmacol Sci}, volume={26}, number={2}, pages={558-572}}

results.title: A cost-effectiveness analysis of pioglitazone plus metformin compared with rosiglitazone plus metformin from a third-party payer perspective in the US.
results.text_hl: While costs were higher among @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@renal, ulcer/@@@@DISEASE_Amputation_Congenital @DISEASE_MESH:C565682 @@@amputation/@@@@DISEASE_Eye_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D005128 @@@neuropathy, and eye complications@@@ in the @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@ plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group, the cost savings for @DISEASE_Liver_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008107 @@@CVD complications@@@ outweighed their economic impact.

citations.NLM: St Charles M, Minshall ME, Pandya BJ, Baran RW, Tunis SL. A cost-effectiveness analysis of pioglitazone plus metformin compared with rosiglitazone plus metformin from a third-party payer perspective in the US. Curr Med Res Opin. 2009 Jun;25(6):1343-53. PMID: 19419339
citations.BibTeX: @article{19419339, title={A cost-effectiveness analysis of pioglitazone plus metformin compared with rosiglitazone plus metformin from a third-party payer perspective in the US.}, author={St Charles M and Minshall ME and Pandya BJ and Baran RW and Tunis SL}, journal={Curr Med Res Opin}, volume={25}, number={6}, pages={1343-53}}

results.title: Role of activation of 5'-adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase in gastric ulcer healing in diabetic rats.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, but not @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@, resulted in a significant decrease in the @DISEASE_Stomach_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D013276 @@@gastric ulcer@@@ area, a significant increase in epithelial regeneration assessed histologically, a significant increase in the number of microvessels in the @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcer@@@ margin, a significant increase in gastric vascular endothelial growth factor concentration and gastric @GENE_VWF @GENE_116669 @@@von Willebrand factor@@@ as well as a significant increase in gastric phospho-@GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_78975 @@@AMPK@@@.

citations.NLM: Baraka AM, Deif MM. Role of activation of 5'-adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase in gastric ulcer healing in diabetic rats. Pharmacology. 2011;88(5-6):275-83. PMID: 22068032
citations.BibTeX: @article{22068032, title={Role of activation of 5'-adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase in gastric ulcer healing in diabetic rats.}, author={Baraka AM and Deif MM}, journal={Pharmacology}, volume={88}, number={5-6}, pages={275-83}}

results.title: Gastroprotective effects of the insulin sensitizers rosiglitazone and metformin against indomethacin-induced gastric ulcers in Type 2 diabetic rats.
results.text_hl: Both @CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@rosiglitazone@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ exhibited gastroprotective effects, as evidenced by significant decreases in the @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcer@@@ index, free and total acid output in gastric juice and gastric mucosal @CHEMICAL_Malondialdehyde @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008315 @@@malondialdehyde@@@ concentrations, with concomitant increases in gastric juice pH (only with @CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@rosiglitazone@@@), @GENE_SLC13A2 @GENE_65202 @@@mucin@@@ concentrations, gastric mucosal concentrations of @CHEMICAL_Nitric_Oxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009569 @@@nitric oxide@@@ and @GENE_CAT @GENE_24248 @@@catalase@@@ activity compared with untreated @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Morsy MA, Ashour OM, Fouad AA, Abdel-Gaber SA. Gastroprotective effects of the insulin sensitizers rosiglitazone and metformin against indomethacin-induced gastric ulcers in Type 2 diabetic rats. Clin Exp Pharmacol Physiol. 2010 Feb;37(2):173-7. PMID: 19566821
citations.BibTeX: @article{19566821, title={Gastroprotective effects of the insulin sensitizers rosiglitazone and metformin against indomethacin-induced gastric ulcers in Type 2 diabetic rats.}, author={Morsy MA and Ashour OM and Fouad AA and Abdel-Gaber SA}, journal={Clin Exp Pharmacol Physiol}, volume={37}, number={2}, pages={173-7}}

results.title: [Potential of combined hypoglycemic, antihypertensive, and hypolipidemic therapy in patients with diabetes mellitus and diabetic foot syndrome].
results.text_hl: Combined treatment of @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ with meformin or glyclaside with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is indicated to @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ having compensated @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 DM@@@ and a small @<m>DISEASE_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulcerative defect@@@ (@DISEASE_Hyaloideoretinal_degeneration_of_Wagner @DISEASE_MESH:C536075 @@@Wagner@@@'s stages I-II) in the absence of @DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@, @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@, and @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@IR@@@.

citations.NLM: Onuchin SG, Elsukova OS, Onuchina EL. [Potential of combined hypoglycemic, antihypertensive, and hypolipidemic therapy in patients with diabetes mellitus and diabetic foot syndrome]. Klin Med (Mosk). 2008;86(8):61-6. PMID: 18819351
citations.BibTeX: @article{18819351, title={[Potential of combined hypoglycemic, antihypertensive, and hypolipidemic therapy in patients with diabetes mellitus and diabetic foot syndrome].}, author={Onuchin SG and Elsukova OS and Onuchina EL}, journal={Klin Med (Mosk)}, volume={86}, number={8}, pages={61-6}}
